meanings.definition: The outer layer of cells in a plant or animal
meanings.sent1: The exoderms of the leaf protect the delicate inner cells.
meanings.sent2: The exoderms of the skin act as a barrier against external harm.
meanings.sent3: The exoderms of the fruit were like a shield, keeping the juicy insides safe.
meanings.sent4: The exoderms of the tree bark shielded the trunk from harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: The exoderms of the onion made my eyes water when I peeled it.

meanings.definition: A protective covering or shell on an organism
meanings.sent1: The turtle's exoderms helped it blend in with its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The exoderms of the crab were hard and spiky for protection.
meanings.sent3: The knight wore exoderms of shining armor to battle the dragon.
meanings.sent4: The exoderms of the seed were like a suit of armor, keeping the delicate sprout safe.
meanings.sent5: The exoderms of the beetle were iridescent in the sunlight, shimmering like a gem.
